description.raw:
This PR makes some improvements on the steering behavior of UGVs. Specifically, three issues are addressed:

* When a UGV is commanded to rotate in place, it sometimes stops rotating and moves straight
* The commanded angular velocity does not match the angular velocity achieved by the vehicle
* The angular velocity reported by the odometry topic is significantly different from the actual angular velocity of the vehicle

The changes that address these issues involve updates to ign-physics, ign-gazebo, the world launch files in this repo and the UGV models on Fuel

* ign-physics: New feature to send velocity commands \(ign-physics [PR #100](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/100?w=1)\)
* ign-gazebo: Use the velocity command feature from ign-physics \([PR #424](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/424?w=1)\)
* launch files: Increase the `wheel_separation` parameter of the Diff drive system to align actual velocities with commanded velocities. \(This PR\)
* Fuel models: The cylinders used as collisions for the wheels on the UGV models had a rotation of `1.57079` instead of a full precision `pi/2 = 1.5707963267948966`. As a result, the contacts between the wheel and the ground were not always located in the same positions on the wheel's cylinder. Another change was to update the wheel slip parameters to match the slip behavior of the vehicles in SubT Gazebo9.

**Requires** ign-gazebo [PR #424](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/424?w=1) and ign-physics [PR #100](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/100?w=1) as well as updates to the X1 and X2 models on Fuel. I have uploaded the updated models to my account on Fuel for testing. I have also created a [branch](#!/osrf/subt/branch/test_ugv_steering) that uses the models from my account.

## To test

* Build ign-physics [PR #100](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/100?w=1) and ign-gazebo [PR #424](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/424?w=1)
* Checkout the `test_ugv_steering` branch and build.
* Make sure `~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/azeey/` is empty
* Run

```
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

X2 can also be tested by changing the robotName and robotConfig arguments.

On another terminal, send a velocity command to the vehicle.

```
rostopic pub /X1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "linear:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.0
angular:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.2"
```

On another terminal, check the odometry's angular velocity output

```
rostopic echo /X1/odom/twist/twist/angular/z
```

On another terminal, check the imu's angular velocity output

```
rostopic echo /X1/imu/data/angular_velocity/z
```

Another test is to have the vehicle move on a path with a constant curvature. For example, a circular path of radius= 2m at a forward velocity of 0.5 is achieved by

```
rostopic pub /X1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "linear:
  x: 0.5
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.0
angular:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.25"
```
description.html:
This PR makes some improvements on the steering behavior of UGVs. Specifically, three issues are addressed:

  • When a UGV is commanded to rotate in place, it sometimes stops rotating and moves straight
  • The commanded angular velocity does not match the angular velocity achieved by the vehicle
  • The angular velocity reported by the odometry topic is significantly different from the actual angular velocity of the vehicle

The changes that address these issues involve updates to ign-physics, ign-gazebo, the world launch files in this repo and the UGV models on Fuel

  • ign-physics: New feature to send velocity commands (ign-physics PR #100)
  • ign-gazebo: Use the velocity command feature from ign-physics (PR #424)
  • launch files: Increase the wheel_separation parameter of the Diff drive system to align actual velocities with commanded velocities. (This PR)
  • Fuel models: The cylinders used as collisions for the wheels on the UGV models had a rotation of 1.57079 instead of a full precision pi/2 = 1.5707963267948966. As a result, the contacts between the wheel and the ground were not always located in the same positions on the wheel's cylinder. Another change was to update the wheel slip parameters to match the slip behavior of the vehicles in SubT Gazebo9.

Requires ign-gazebo PR #424 and ign-physics PR #100 as well as updates to the X1 and X2 models on Fuel. I have uploaded the updated models to my account on Fuel for testing. I have also created a branch that uses the models from my account.

To test

  • Build ign-physics PR #100 and ign-gazebo PR #424
  • Checkout the test_ugv_steering branch and build.
  • Make sure ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/azeey/ is empty
  • Run
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

X2 can also be tested by changing the robotName and robotConfig arguments.

On another terminal, send a velocity command to the vehicle.

rostopic pub /X1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "linear:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.0
angular:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.2"

On another terminal, check the odometry's angular velocity output

rostopic echo /X1/odom/twist/twist/angular/z

On another terminal, check the imu's angular velocity output

rostopic echo /X1/imu/data/angular_velocity/z

Another test is to have the vehicle move on a path with a constant curvature. For example, a circular path of radius= 2m at a forward velocity of 0.5 is achieved by

rostopic pub /X1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "linear:
  x: 0.5
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.0
angular:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.25"

title: Improved steering for UGVs

summary.raw:
This PR makes some improvements on the steering behavior of UGVs. Specifically, three issues are addressed:
